docs.text:
1. Taketo Tsujimoto, Yuki Yonemoto*, Hiroki Shibata, Takuya Mieno, Yuto Nakashima, Shunsuke Inenaga Subsequence Matching and LCS under Cartesian-Tree Equivalence Theory of Computing Systems (to appear)

  3. Takuya Mieno*, Mitsuru Funakoshi Data Structures for Computing Unique Palindromes in Static and Non-Static Strings Algorithmica 86 (2024): 852-873

  4. Kazuki Mitani, Takuya Mieno*, Kazuhisa Seto, Takashi Horiyama Finding top-k longest palindromes in substrings Theoretical Computer Science 979 (2023): 114183

docs.title: Proceedings (Peer Reviewed)
docs.text:
1. Takuya Mieno Compact representation of maximal palindromes Proc. 37th Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2026), to appear.

  2. Hiroto Fujimaru, Takuya Mieno, Shunsuke Inenaga On the number of MUSs crossing a position Proc. 32nd International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2025), 124-132, 2025.

  3. Shoma Sekizaki, Takuya Mieno Longest Unbordered Factors on Run-Length Encoded Strings Proc. 32nd International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2025), 233-247, 2025.

  4. Takuya Mieno, Shunsuke Inenaga Space-Efficient Online Computation of String Net Occurrences Proc. 36th Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2025), 23:1-23:13, 2025.

  5. Waseem Akram, Takuya Mieno Sorted Consecutive Occurrence Queries in Substrings Proc. 36th Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2025), 24:1-24:15, 2025.

  6. Yuki Yonemoto, Takuya Mieno, Shunsuke Inenaga, Ryo Yoshinaka, Ayumi Shinohara Subsequence Matching and LCS with Segment Number Constraints Proc. 14th International Conference on Algorithms and Complexity (CIAC 2025), 136-150, 2025.

  7. Takuya Mieno, Shun Takahashi, Kazuhisa Seto, Takashi Horiyama Online and Offline Algorithms for Counting Distinct Closed Factors via Sliding Suffix Trees Proc. 50th International Conference on Current Trends in Theory and Practice of Computer Science (SOFSEM 2025), 172-183, 2025.

  8. Wataru Sumiyoshi, Takuya Mieno, Shunsuke Inenaga Faster and simpler online/sliding rightmost Lempel-Ziv factorizations Proc. 31st International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2024), 321-335, 2024.

  9. Mitsuru Funakoshi, Takuya Mieno, Yuto Nakashima, Shunsuke Inenaga, Hideo Bannai, Masayuki Takeda Computing maximal palindromes in non-standard matching models Proc. 35th International Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms (IWOCA 2024), 165-179, 2024.

  10. Shunsuke Inenaga, Takuya Mieno, Hiroki Arimura, Mitsuru Funakoshi, Yuta Fujishige Computing Minimal Absent Words and Extended Bispecial Factors with CDAWG Space Proc. 35th International Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms (IWOCA 2024), 327-340, 2024.

  11. Taketo Tsujimoto, Hiroki Shibata, Takuya Mieno, Yuto Nakashima, Shunsuke Inenaga Computing Longest Common Subsequence under Cartesian-Tree Matching Model Proc. 35th International Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms (IWOCA 2024), 369-381, 2024.

  12. Kazuki Mitani, Takuya Mieno, Kazuhisa Seto, Takashi Horiyama Shortest cover after edit Proc. 35th Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2024), 24:1-24:15, 2024.

  13. Kouta Okabe, Takuya Mieno, Yuto Nakashima, Shunsuke Inenaga, Hideo Bannai Linear-time computation of generalized minimal absent words for multiple strings Proc. 30th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2023), 331-344, 2023.

  14. Kazuki Mitani, Takuya Mieno, Kazuhisa Seto, Takashi Horiyama Internal Longest Palindrome Queries in Optimal Time Proc. 17th International Conference and Workshops on Algorithms and Computation (WALCOM 2023), 127–138, 2023.

  15. Takuya Mieno, Mitsuru Funakoshi, Shunsuke Inenaga Computing Palindromes on a Trie in Linear Time Proc. 33rd International Symposium on Algorithms and Computation (ISAAC 2022), 15:1-15:15, 2022.

  16. Laurentius Leonard, Shunsuke Inenaga, Hideo Bannai, Takuya Mieno Online algorithms for finding distinct substrings with length and multiple prefix and suffix conditions Proc. 29th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2022), 24-37, 2022.

  17. Tooru Akagi, Kouta Okabe, Takuya Mieno, Yuto Nakashima, Shunsuke Inenaga Minimal Absent Words on Run-Length Encoded Strings Proc. 33rd Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2022), 27:1-27:17, 2022.

  18. Takuya Mieno, Shunsuke Inenaga, Takashi Horiyama RePair Grammars are the Smallest Grammars for Fibonacci Words Proc. 33rd Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2022), 26:1-26:17, 2022.

  19. Tsubasa Oizumi, Takeshi Kai, Takuya Mieno, Shunsuke Inenaga, Hiroki Arimura Cartesian Tree Subsequence Matching Proc. 33rd Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2022), 14:1-14:18, 2022.

  20. Takuya Mieno, Mitsuru Funakoshi Shortest Unique Palindromic Substring Queries in Semi-dynamic Settings Proc. 33rd International Workshop on Combinatorial Algorithms (IWOCA 2022), 425-438, 2022.

  21. Hideo Bannai, Mitsuru Funakoshi, Tomohiro I, Dominik Köppl, Takuya Mieno, Takaaki Nishimoto A separation of γ and b via Thue−Morse Words Proc. 28th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2021), 167-178, 2021.

  22. Takumi Ideue, Takuya Mieno, Mitsuru Funakoshi, Yuto Nakashima, Shunsuke Inenaga, Masayuki Takeda On the approximation ratio of LZ-End to LZ77 Proc. 28th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2021), 114-126, 2021.

  23. Mitsuru Funakoshi, Takuya Mieno Minimal unique palindromic substrings after single-character substitution Proc. 28th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2021), 33-46, 2021.

  24. Takuya Mieno, Solon P. Pissis, Leen Stougie, Michelle Sweering String Sanitization Under Edit Distance: Improved and Generalized Proc. 32nd Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2021), 19:1–19:18, 2021.

  25. Hideo Bannai, Takuya Mieno, Yuto Nakashima Lyndon Words, the Three Squares Lemma, and Primitive Squares Proc. 27th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2020), 265-273, 2020.

  26. Takuya Mieno, Yuki Kuhara, Tooru Akagi, Yuta Fujishige, Yuto Nakashima, Shunsuke Inenaga, Hideo Bannai, Masayuki Takeda Minimal Unique Substrings and Minimal Absent Words in a Sliding Window Proc. 46th International Conference on Current Trends in Theory and Practice of Computer Science (SOFSEM 2020), 148-160, 2020.

  27. Takuya Mieno, Dominik Köppl, Yuto Nakashima, Shunsuke Inenaga, Hideo Bannai, Masayuki Takeda Compact Data Structures for Shortest Unique Substring Queries Proc. 26th International Symposium on String Processing and Information Retrieval (SPIRE 2019), 107-123, 2019.

  29. Takuya Mieno, Shunsuke Inenaga, Hideo Bannai, Masayuki Takeda Tight Bounds on the Maximum Number of Shortest Unique Substrings Proc. 28th Annual Symposium on Combinatorial Pattern Matching (CPM 2017), 24:1-24:11, 2017.

docs.title: 学歴
docs.text:
• 2011年（平成23年）4月1日：九州大学 理学部 物理学科 入学
  • 2015年（平成27年）3月25日：同上（情報理学コース） 卒業
  • 2015年（平成27年）4月1日：九州大学 大学院システム情報科学府 情報学専攻 修士課程 入学
  • 2017年（平成29年）3月24日：同上 修了
  • 2019年（平成31年）4月1日：九州大学 大学院システム情報科学府 情報学専攻 博士後期課程 入学
  • 2021年（令和3年）9月24日：同上 修了
  • 2021年9月：学位：博士（情報科学）－九州大学

docs.title: 職歴
docs.text:
• 2017年（平成29年）4月1日： 株式会社富士通九州システムサービス （現・富士通株式会社）入社
  • 2019年（平成31年）2月20日：株式会社富士通九州システムズ1（現・富士通株式会社） 退社
  • 2021年（令和3年）10月1日 - 2022年（令和4年）3月31日: 北海道大学大学院情報科学研究院 博士研究員2
  • 2022年（令和4年）4月1日 - : 電気通信大学 大学院情報理工学研究科 助教

現在に至る

  • ○三重野琢也，山内由紀子，来嶋秀治，山下雅史 エネルギー制限つきエージェントによるデータ配送問題 第10回情報科学ワークショップ (2014.09)

docs.title: 共著者の国内発表
docs.text:
